text: Opogona isotalanta is a moth of the family Tineidae. It is found in Sri Lanka. The wingspan is about 10 mm. The forewings are shining brassy-yellow with a bronzy-fuscous basal patch occupying about one-fifth of the wing, with the edge direct, rather irregular and the apical fourth bronzy-fuscous, the edge similar. The hindwings are grey.Exotic Microlep. 4: 8 ==References== Category:Opogona Category:Moths described in 1930
title: Opogona isotalanta
